result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander Angus Ninke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alexander Angus Ninke is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alexander Angus Ninke was found guilty of Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
- Sign up for Probation on 10/17/22 by 03:00 PM
- 3 days against ultimate sentence

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

1:01 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Alexander Angus Ninke in court.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Alexander Angus Ninke. ADA Smestad recites agreement, amends Ct 1 to remove modifier. Atty. Petersen requests that DE be able to complete DV assessment online. Court reponds. DE pleads NO CONTEST to amended Ct 1 - Battery without modifier. DE sworn. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 - Battery without modifier. On motion of the State without objection, Court dismisses Ct 2. Sentencing recommendations. Defendant advised of appeal rights. 

Court orders: 
Ct 1 - Battery without modifier
S/W 1 year probation with conditions:
- No abusive contact with Emily N.
- Complete Domestic Violence Assessment and follow any recommendations
- Submit letter of apology within 60 days to Emily N.
- Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections 
- Court Costs $243
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200

Money on file forfeited and applied, payment plan approved to continue for attorney fees.
3 days jail credit in the event of revocation. 
Defendant to report to probation no later than 3:00 PM today. 
Adjourned: 1:12 PM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Correspondence to Court from Atty Petersen requesting to reschedule 9/22/22 PSC.  Per RWM: please reset for plea and sentencing. JA scheduled.  tfy/gll

$500 bond on file.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Emily N. EXCEPT electronic or written communication regarding children OR third-party contact through Carla N. or Greg T. regarding children.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

Atty Rockow states victim is requesting contact with DE re: child.  State is requesting bond be amended to written communication regarding child.  Court amends bond to include electronic communication re: child.  Court confirms address.  Adjourned: 3:13
